import ProjectHeader from'./../projectPage/ProjectHeader.js';import SectionOne from'./../projectPage/SectionOne.js';import Image from'./../projectPage/Image.js';import Text from'./../projectPage/Text.js';import ReactPlayer from'react-player';import Divider from'./../projectPage/Divider.js';var data={'heroVideo':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/hero.mp4')};var a={'text':'Joy Story have created a collaborative experience for shared spaces, giving companies the tools to increase employee and customer engagement. Insights from market research drove us to design experiences that encourage collaboration rather than competition with balanced foot controls that require teams to work together to complete the Tilt Maze.','image':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/3.png'),'image2':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/1.png')};var b={'title':'Gathering Insights','text':"As part of a comprehensive research and testing process, we visited train stations and interviewed station managers and transformation teams as well as business owners in order to gather qualitative data from which to draw insights. In this way, the Giant Tilt Maze is designed to form the peak of an experience within a space.",'image':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/5.png')};var d={'title':'Public Spaces - London Bridge Station','text':"Through Netowrk Rail's transformation team, we had the opportunity to test the tilt maze with passengers on a weekday afternoon at London Bridge station. The LED flashes faster and faster as time runs out. If the ball reaches the destination, the destination will light up green. The next destination will then light up red and so on. The amount of time given to reach the next destination will decrease with each point scored. The goal is to get as many points as possible without running out of time.",col:"col-12",align:"left",type:"text",font:"15px",margin:"20px 120px 100px 100px"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Divider,null),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Text,{text:"Background",col:"col-12",type:"title"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(SectionOne,{title:b.title,text:b.text,image:b.image}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(SectionOne,{title:c.title,text:c.text,image:c.image}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Divider,null),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Text,{text:"Testing",col:"col-12",type:"title",margin:"0px 0px 0px 84px"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(SectionOne,{title:d.title,text:d.text,image:d.image}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(SectionOne,{title:e.title,text:e.text,image:e.image}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Divider,null),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Text,{text:"Business Strategy",col:"col-12",type:"title"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Image,{image:f.image,col:"col-12",height:"auto",padding:"0px 100px 0px 100px",margin:"100px 0px 50px 0px"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Text,{text:"Year 1",col:"col-12",type:"sectionOne-title",margin:"0px 84px 0px 84px"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Text,{text:"The first year is largely spent refining the tilt maze into a finished product designed for indoor environments, such as offices and arcades. Sales will begin in September, with a marketing drive beginning in July to start to push sales for the end of the year, targeting the Christmas period as a time for bringing people together, although we don\u2019t expect much seasonality in sales. Four of us will be working part time (10 hours a week), and one full time to help drive our product\u2019s success but to ensure a steady stream of income from alternative sources. We will work from our existing accommodation and we will assemble the product ourselves after receiving the constituent parts from our suppliers. The final product will then be shipped to the customer with the final assembly and set up to be completed according to simple instructions. A \xA375,000 seed investment spread over the first financial year will keep us in the black.",col:"col-12",align:"left",type:"text",font:"15px",margin:"20px 120px 30px 84px"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Text,{text:"Year 2",col:"col-12",type:"sectionOne-title",margin:"0px 84px 0px 84px"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Text,{text:"We will all start working full time at the beginning of the second year. Our strategy to maintain market presence is cost leadership, whereby we will use some of our R&D budget to reduce the manufacturing cost of our product, as well as establish better relationships with suppliers and bulk purchasing parts. We will use the beginning of the year to develop our second product, a more robust version of first, to be sold for outdoor and public places (train stations, parks, shopping centres). These sales will be born of existing relationships with Network Rail, and through the borough councils or private entities responsible for a public space. Crucially, we forecast becoming profitable by the end of the second year.",col:"col-12",align:"left",type:"text",font:"15px",margin:"20px 120px 30px 84px"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Text,{text:"Years 3-5",col:"col-12",type:"sectionOne-title",margin:"0px 84px 0px 84px"}),/*#__PURE__*/React.createElement(Text,{text:"At the beginning of year 3, we start international sales of product one and start employing others to facilitate this. We will employ technicians to take over manufacturing and we will be largely involved in R&D and sales. This will give us the time we need to begin developing an entirely new third product. In year 4 we will begin selling this third product in our existing markets, leveraging our established position to drive sales early and gain market share as the domestic market for product 1 becomes saturated. In year 5, we will begin international sales of the more robust tilt maze in territories where the original product has become established in order to serve customers in those regions who require a more durable product.",col:"col-12",align:"left",type:"text",font:"15px",margin:"20px 120px 30px 84px"}));}export default JoyStory;

sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; // Import the Component component from React import ProjectHeader from './../projectPage/ProjectHeader.js' import SectionOne from './../projectPage/SectionOne.js' import Image from './../projectPage/Image.js' import Text from './../projectPage/Text.js' import ReactPlayer from 'react-player' import Divider from './../projectPage/Divider.js'; const data = { 'heroVideo':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/hero.mp4'), } const a = { 'text':'Joy Story have created a collaborative experience for shared spaces, giving companies the tools to increase employee and customer engagement. Insights from market research drove us to design experiences that encourage collaboration rather than competition with balanced foot controls that require teams to work together to complete the Tilt Maze.', 'image':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/3.png'), 'image2':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/1.png'), } const b = { 'title':'Gathering Insights', 'text':"As part of a comprehensive research and testing process, we visited train stations and interviewed station managers and transformation teams as well as business owners in order to gather qualitative data from which to draw insights. We also analysed over 10,000 google reviews from the UK's 2500+ train stations, from which this word cloud was generated. We discovered that interactions with between people made a huge difference to people's perception of their experience and these were commonly referenced in reviews (Staff, Service, People).", 'image':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/2.png'), } const c = { 'title':'Peak-End Theory', 'text':"Peak-End Theory suggests that when people reflect on their experiences, the part of the experience with the highest emotional intensity (positive or negative) and the end of the experience are given a lot of weight. This effect was noticed in the analysed reviews and interviews, with people using such anecdotes from an experience to inform their entire opinion of the quality of a space or an experience. In this way, the Giant Tilt Maze is designed to form the peak of an experience within a space.", 'image':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/5.png'), } const d = { 'title':'Public Spaces - London Bridge Station', 'text':"Through Netowrk Rail's transformation team, we had the opportunity to test the tilt maze with passengers on a weekday afternoon at London Bridge station. We received fantastic feedback and engagement with people enjoying the experience. Trying to complete a task together encourages communication which then starts to branch out into a more general discussion.", 'image':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/4.jpg'), } const e = { 'title':'Businesses - Brompton Bicycles', 'text':'We tested the prototype at the Brompton Bicycles factory is West London. They organised teams to compete against each other and they started to develop different strategies together, holding onto each other for support and encouraging each other.', 'image':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/7.png'), } const f = { 'image':require('./../../content/projects/joyStory/6.png'), } function JoyStory(props) { return(
) } export default JoyStory;
